description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides support to the World Health Organization's Department of maternal, Newborn, Child and Adolescent Health (DMNCAH) to strengthen maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health services in high burden countries, specifically: working with six countries to develop and revise integrated policies and costed strategies on universal access to effective interventions; providing technical assistance to enable high-burden countries to increase coverage of selected interventions; providing technical assistance on linkages between HIV, tuberculosis, malaria and maternal and child health; and assisting countries to improve quality of maternal and child health services by building health workers capacity to deliver quality integrated care during pregnancy, childbirth and after birth. The total value of this initiative is $2.0 million to be expensed during the 2011-12 financial year.
